trans-unit.source: Game technologies for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Game technologies for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: In this guide, you'll learn about the technologies available for developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) games.
trans-unit.target: In this guide, you'll learn about the technologies available for developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) games.

trans-unit.source: Game technologies for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Game technologies for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: In this guide, you'll learn about the technologies available for developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) games.
trans-unit.target: In this guide, you'll learn about the technologies available for developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) games.

trans-unit.source: Benefits of Windows 10 for game development
trans-unit.target: Benefits of Windows 10 for game development

trans-unit.source: With the introduction of UWP in Windows 10, your Windows 10 titles will be able to span all of the Microsoft platforms.
trans-unit.target: With the introduction of UWP in Windows 10, your Windows 10 titles will be able to span all of the Microsoft platforms.

trans-unit.source: With free migration from previous versions of Windows, there is a steadily increasing number of Windows 10 clients.
trans-unit.target: With free migration from previous versions of Windows, there is a steadily increasing number of Windows 10 clients.

trans-unit.source: The combination of these two things means that your Windows 10 titles will be able to reach a huge number of customers through the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: The combination of these two things means that your Windows 10 titles will be able to reach a huge number of customers through the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: In addition, Windows 10 offers many new features that are particularly beneficial to games:
trans-unit.target: In addition, Windows 10 offers many new features that are particularly beneficial to games:

trans-unit.source: Reduced memory paging and reduced overall memory system size
trans-unit.target: Reduced memory paging and reduced overall memory system size

trans-unit.source: Improved graphics memory management actively allocates and protects more memory for the foreground game
trans-unit.target: Improved graphics memory management actively allocates and protects more memory for the foreground game

trans-unit.source: UWP Games with C++ and DirectX
trans-unit.target: UWP Games with C++ and DirectX

trans-unit.source: Real-time games requiring high performance should make use of the DirectX APIs.
trans-unit.target: Real-time games requiring high performance should make use of the DirectX APIs.

trans-unit.source: DirectX is a collection of native APIs for creating games and multimedia applications that require high performance, such as 3D games.
trans-unit.target: DirectX is a collection of native APIs for creating games and multimedia applications that require high performance, such as 3D games.

trans-unit.source: Because the DirectX APIs are native, C++ is the only language supported for use with DirectX.
trans-unit.target: Because the DirectX APIs are native, C++ is the only language supported for use with DirectX.

trans-unit.source: Development Environment
trans-unit.target: Development Environment

trans-unit.source: To create games for UWP, you'll need to set up your development environment by installing a copy of Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: To create games for UWP, you'll need to set up your development environment by installing a copy of Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 allows you to create UWP apps and provides tools for game development:
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 allows you to create UWP apps and provides tools for game development:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio tools for DX game programming - Visual Studio provides tools for creating, editing, previewing, and exporting image, model, and shader resources.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio tools for DX game programming - Visual Studio provides tools for creating, editing, previewing, and exporting image, model, and shader resources.

trans-unit.source: There are also tools that you can use to convert resources at build time and debug DirectX graphics code.
trans-unit.target: There are also tools that you can use to convert resources at build time and debug DirectX graphics code.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use Visual Studio tools for game programming](set-up-visual-studio-for-game-development.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use Visual Studio tools for game programming](set-up-visual-studio-for-game-development.md).

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio graphics diagnostics features - Graphics diagnostic tools are now available from within Windows as an optional feature.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio graphics diagnostics features - Graphics diagnostic tools are now available from within Windows as an optional feature.

trans-unit.source: The diagnostic tools allow you to do graphics debugging, graphics frame analysis, and monitor GPU usage in real time.
trans-unit.target: The diagnostic tools allow you to do graphics debugging, graphics frame analysis, and monitor GPU usage in real time.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use the DirectX runtime and Visual Studio graphics diagnostic features](use-the-directx-runtime-and-visual-studio-graphics-diagnostic-features.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use the DirectX runtime and Visual Studio graphics diagnostic features](use-the-directx-runtime-and-visual-studio-graphics-diagnostic-features.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Prepare your Universal Windows Platform and DirectX game programming environment.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Prepare your Universal Windows Platform and DirectX game programming environment.

trans-unit.source: Getting Started with DirectX Game Project Templates
trans-unit.target: Getting Started with DirectX Game Project Templates

trans-unit.source: After setting up you development environment, you can use one of the DirectX related project templates to create your UWP DirectX game.
trans-unit.target: After setting up you development environment, you can use one of the DirectX related project templates to create your UWP DirectX game.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 has three templates available for creating new UWP DirectX projects, **DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows)**, **DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows)**, and **DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows)**.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 has three templates available for creating new UWP DirectX projects, **DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows)**, **DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows)**, and **DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows)**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Create a Universal Windows Platform and DirectX game project from a template](user-interface.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Create a Universal Windows Platform and DirectX game project from a template](user-interface.md).

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 APIs
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 provides a an extensive collection of APIs that are useful for game development.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 provides a an extensive collection of APIs that are useful for game development.

trans-unit.source: There are APIs for almost all aspects of games including, 3D Graphics, 2D Graphics, Audio, Input, Text Resources, User Interface, and networking.
trans-unit.target: There are APIs for almost all aspects of games including, 3D Graphics, 2D Graphics, Audio, Input, Text Resources, User Interface, and networking.

trans-unit.source: There are many APIs related to game development, but not all games need to use all of the APIs.
trans-unit.target: There are many APIs related to game development, but not all games need to use all of the APIs.

trans-unit.source: For example, some games will only use 3D graphics and only make use of Direct3D, some games may only use 2D graphics and only make use of Direct2D, and still other games may make use of both.
trans-unit.target: For example, some games will only use 3D graphics and only make use of Direct3D, some games may only use 2D graphics and only make use of Direct2D, and still other games may make use of both.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram shows the game development related APIs grouped by functionality type.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows the game development related APIs grouped by functionality type.

trans-unit.source: game platform technologies
trans-unit.target: game platform technologies

trans-unit.source: 3D Graphics - Windows 10 supports two 3D graphics API sets, Direct3D 11, and [Direct3D 12](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dn899121).
trans-unit.target: 3D Graphics - Windows 10 supports two 3D graphics API sets, Direct3D 11, and [Direct3D 12](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dn899121).

trans-unit.source: Both of these APIs provide the capability to create 3D and 2D graphics.
trans-unit.target: Both of these APIs provide the capability to create 3D and 2D graphics.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 11 and Direct3D 12 are not used together, but either can be used with any of the APIs in the 2D Graphics and UI group.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 11 and Direct3D 12 are not used together, but either can be used with any of the APIs in the 2D Graphics and UI group.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the graphics APIs in your game, see [Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games](an-introduction-to-3d-graphics-with-directx.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the graphics APIs in your game, see [Basic 3D graphics for DirectX games](an-introduction-to-3d-graphics-with-directx.md).

trans-unit.source: API
trans-unit.target: API

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 12
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 12 introduces the next version of Direct3D, the 3D graphics API at the heart of DirectX.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12 introduces the next version of Direct3D, the 3D graphics API at the heart of DirectX.

trans-unit.source: This version of Direct3D is designed to be faster and more efficient than previous versions of Direct3D.
trans-unit.target: This version of Direct3D is designed to be faster and more efficient than previous versions of Direct3D.

trans-unit.source: The tradeoff for Direct3D 12's increased speed is that it is lower level and requires you to manage your graphics resources yourself and have more extensive graphics programming experience to realize the increased speed.
trans-unit.target: The tradeoff for Direct3D 12's increased speed is that it is lower level and requires you to manage your graphics resources yourself and have more extensive graphics programming experience to realize the increased speed.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use Direct3D 12 when you need to maximize your game's performance and your game is CPU bound.
trans-unit.target: Use Direct3D 12 when you need to maximize your game's performance and your game is CPU bound.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [Direct3d 12](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dn899121) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [Direct3d 12](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dn899121) documentation.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 11 is the previous version of Direct3D and allows you to create 3D graphics using a higher level of hardware abstraction than D3D 12.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 11 is the previous version of Direct3D and allows you to create 3D graphics using a higher level of hardware abstraction than D3D 12.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use Direct3D 11 if you have existing Direct3D 11 code, your game is not CPU bound, or you want the benefit of having resources managed for you.
trans-unit.target: Use Direct3D 11 if you have existing Direct3D 11 code, your game is not CPU bound, or you want the benefit of having resources managed for you.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [Direct3D 11](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476080) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [Direct3D 11](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476080) documentation.

trans-unit.source: 2D Graphics and UI - APIs concerning 2D graphics such as text and user interfaces.
trans-unit.target: 2D Graphics and UI - APIs concerning 2D graphics such as text and user interfaces.

trans-unit.source: All of the 2D graphics and UI APIs are optional.
trans-unit.target: All of the 2D graphics and UI APIs are optional.

trans-unit.source: API
trans-unit.target: API

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Direct2D
trans-unit.target: Direct2D

trans-unit.source: Direct2D is a hardware-accelerated, immediate-mode, 2-D graphics API that provides high performance and high-quality rendering for 2-D geometry, bitmaps, and text.
trans-unit.target: Direct2D is a hardware-accelerated, immediate-mode, 2-D graphics API that provides high performance and high-quality rendering for 2-D geometry, bitmaps, and text.

trans-unit.source: The Direct2D API is built on Direct3D and is designed to interoperate well with GDI, GDI+, and Direct3D.
trans-unit.target: The Direct2D API is built on Direct3D and is designed to interoperate well with GDI, GDI+, and Direct3D.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Direct2D can be used instead of Direct3D to provide graphics for pure 2D games such as a side-scroller or board game, or can be used with Direct3D to simplify creation of 2D graphics in a 3D game, such as a user interface or heads-up-display.
trans-unit.target: Direct2D can be used instead of Direct3D to provide graphics for pure 2D games such as a side-scroller or board game, or can be used with Direct3D to simplify creation of 2D graphics in a 3D game, such as a user interface or heads-up-display.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [Direct2D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd370990) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [Direct2D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd370990) documentation.

trans-unit.source: DirectWrite
trans-unit.target: DirectWrite

trans-unit.source: DirectWrite provides extra capabilities for working with text and can be used with Direct3D or Direct2D to provide text output for user interfaces or other areas where text is required.
trans-unit.target: DirectWrite provides extra capabilities for working with text and can be used with Direct3D or Direct2D to provide text output for user interfaces or other areas where text is required.

trans-unit.source: DirectWrite supports measuring, drawing, and hit-testing of multi-format text.
trans-unit.target: DirectWrite supports measuring, drawing, and hit-testing of multi-format text.

trans-unit.source: DirectWrite handles text in all supported languages for global and localized applications.
trans-unit.target: DirectWrite handles text in all supported languages for global and localized applications.

trans-unit.source: DirectWrite also provides a low-level glyph rendering API for developers who want to perform their own layout and Unicode-to-glyph processing.
trans-unit.target: DirectWrite also provides a low-level glyph rendering API for developers who want to perform their own layout and Unicode-to-glyph processing.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [DirectWrite](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd368038) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [DirectWrite](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd368038) documentation.

trans-unit.source: DirectComposition
trans-unit.target: DirectComposition

trans-unit.source: DirectComposition is a Windows component that enables high-performance bitmap composition with transforms, effects, and animations.
trans-unit.target: DirectComposition is a Windows component that enables high-performance bitmap composition with transforms, effects, and animations.

trans-unit.source: Application developers can use the DirectComposition API to create visually engaging user interfaces that feature rich and fluid animated transitions from one visual to another.
trans-unit.target: Application developers can use the DirectComposition API to create visually engaging user interfaces that feature rich and fluid animated transitions from one visual to another.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: DirectComposition is designed to simplify the process of composing visuals and creating animated transitions.
trans-unit.target: DirectComposition is designed to simplify the process of composing visuals and creating animated transitions.

trans-unit.source: If your game requires complex user interfaces, you can use DirectComposition to simplify the creation and management of the UI.
trans-unit.target: If your game requires complex user interfaces, you can use DirectComposition to simplify the creation and management of the UI.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [DirectComposition](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437371) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [DirectComposition](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437371) documentation.

trans-unit.source: Audio - APIs concerning playing audio and applying audio effects.
trans-unit.target: Audio - APIs concerning playing audio and applying audio effects.

trans-unit.source: For information about using the audio APIs in your game, see [Audio for games](working-with-audio-in-your-directx-game.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about using the audio APIs in your game, see [Audio for games](working-with-audio-in-your-directx-game.md).

trans-unit.source: API
trans-unit.target: API

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: XAudio2
trans-unit.target: XAudio2

trans-unit.source: XAudio2 is a low-level audio API that provides a foundation for signal processing and mixing.
trans-unit.target: XAudio2 is a low-level audio API that provides a foundation for signal processing and mixing.

trans-unit.source: XAudio is designed to be very responsive for game audio engines while maintaining the ability to create custom audio effects and complex chains of audio effects and filters.
trans-unit.target: XAudio is designed to be very responsive for game audio engines while maintaining the ability to create custom audio effects and complex chains of audio effects and filters.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use XAudio2 when your game needs to play sounds with minimal overhead and delay.
trans-unit.target: Use XAudio2 when your game needs to play sounds with minimal overhead and delay.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [XAudio2](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405049) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [XAudio2](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405049) documentation.

trans-unit.source: Media Foundation
trans-unit.target: Media Foundation

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Media Foundation is designed for the playback of media files and streams, both audio and video, but can also be used in games when higher level functionality than XAudio2 is required and some additional overhead is acceptable.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Media Foundation is designed for the playback of media files and streams, both audio and video, but can also be used in games when higher level functionality than XAudio2 is required and some additional overhead is acceptable.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Media foundation is particularly useful for cinematic scenes or non-interactive components of your game.
trans-unit.target: Media foundation is particularly useful for cinematic scenes or non-interactive components of your game.

trans-unit.source: Media foundation is also useful for decoding audio files for playback using XAudio2.
trans-unit.target: Media foundation is also useful for decoding audio files for playback using XAudio2.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [Microsoft Media Foundation overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms694197).
trans-unit.target: See the [Microsoft Media Foundation overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms694197).

trans-unit.source: Input - APIs concerning input from the keyboard, mouse, gamepad, and other user input sources.
trans-unit.target: Input - APIs concerning input from the keyboard, mouse, gamepad, and other user input sources.

trans-unit.source: API
trans-unit.target: API

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: XInput
trans-unit.target: XInput

trans-unit.source: The XInput Game Controller API enables applications to receive input from game controllers.
trans-unit.target: The XInput Game Controller API enables applications to receive input from game controllers.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: If your game needs to support gampad input and you have existing XInput code, you can continue to make use of XInput.
trans-unit.target: If your game needs to support gampad input and you have existing XInput code, you can continue to make use of XInput.

trans-unit.source: XInput has been replaced by Windows.Gaming.Input for UWP, and if you're writing new input code, you should use Windows.Gaming.Input instead of XInput.
trans-unit.target: XInput has been replaced by Windows.Gaming.Input for UWP, and if you're writing new input code, you should use Windows.Gaming.Input instead of XInput.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [XInput](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405053) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [XInput](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405053) documentation.

trans-unit.source: Windows.Gaming.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.Gaming.Input

trans-unit.source: The Windows.Gaming.Input API replaces XInput and provides the same functionality with the following advantages over Xinput:
trans-unit.target: The Windows.Gaming.Input API replaces XInput and provides the same functionality with the following advantages over Xinput:

trans-unit.source: Lower resource usage
trans-unit.target: Lower resource usage

trans-unit.source: Lower API call latency for retrieving input
trans-unit.target: Lower API call latency for retrieving input

trans-unit.source: The ability to work with more than 4 gamepads at once
trans-unit.target: The ability to work with more than 4 gamepads at once

trans-unit.source: The ability to access addition Xbox One gamepad features, such as the trigger vibration motors
trans-unit.target: The ability to access addition Xbox One gamepad features, such as the trigger vibration motors

trans-unit.source: The ability to be notified when controllers connect/disconnect via event instead of polling
trans-unit.target: The ability to be notified when controllers connect/disconnect via event instead of polling

trans-unit.source: The ability to attribute input to a specific user (Windows.System.User)
trans-unit.target: The ability to attribute input to a specific user (Windows.System.User)

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: If your game needs to support gamepad input and is not using existing XInput code or you need one of the benefits listed above, you should make use of Windows.Gaming.Input.
trans-unit.target: If your game needs to support gamepad input and is not using existing XInput code or you need one of the benefits listed above, you should make use of Windows.Gaming.Input.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [Windows.Gaming.Input](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn707817) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [Windows.Gaming.Input](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn707817) documentation.

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow

trans-unit.source: The Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow class provides events for tracking pointer presses and movement, and key down and key up events.
trans-unit.target: The Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow class provides events for tracking pointer presses and movement, and key down and key up events.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindows events when you need to track the mouse or key presses in your game.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindows events when you need to track the mouse or key presses in your game.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See [Move-look controls for games](tutorial--adding-move-look-controls-to-your-directx-game.md) for more information about using the mouse or keyboard in your game.
trans-unit.target: See [Move-look controls for games](tutorial--adding-move-look-controls-to-your-directx-game.md) for more information about using the mouse or keyboard in your game.

trans-unit.source: Math - APIs concerning simplifying commonly used mathematical operations.
trans-unit.target: Math - APIs concerning simplifying commonly used mathematical operations.

trans-unit.source: API
trans-unit.target: API

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: DirectXMath
trans-unit.target: DirectXMath

trans-unit.source: The DirectXMath API provides SIMD-friendly C++ types and functions for common linear algebra and graphics math operations common to games.
trans-unit.target: The DirectXMath API provides SIMD-friendly C++ types and functions for common linear algebra and graphics math operations common to games.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use of DirectXMath is optional and simplifies common mathematical operations.
trans-unit.target: Use of DirectXMath is optional and simplifies common mathematical operations.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the [DirectXMath](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437833) documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [DirectXMath](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437833) documentation.

trans-unit.source: Networking - APIs concerning communicating with other computers and devices over either the Internet or private networks.
trans-unit.target: Networking - APIs concerning communicating with other computers and devices over either the Internet or private networks.

trans-unit.source: API
trans-unit.target: API

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Windows.Networking.Sockets
trans-unit.target: Windows.Networking.Sockets

trans-unit.source: The Windows.Networking.Sockets namespace provides TCP and UDP sockets that allow reliable or unreliable network communication.
trans-unit.target: The Windows.Networking.Sockets namespace provides TCP and UDP sockets that allow reliable or unreliable network communication.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use Windows.Networking.Sockets if your game needs to communicate with other computers or devices over the network.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows.Networking.Sockets if your game needs to communicate with other computers or devices over the network.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See [Work with networking in your game](work-with-networking-in-your-directx-game.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Work with networking in your game](work-with-networking-in-your-directx-game.md).

trans-unit.source: Windows.Web.HTTP
trans-unit.target: Windows.Web.HTTP

trans-unit.source: The Windows.Web.HTTP namespace provides a reliable connection to HTTP servers that can be used to access a web site.
trans-unit.target: The Windows.Web.HTTP namespace provides a reliable connection to HTTP servers that can be used to access a web site.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use Windows.Web.HTTP when your game needs to access a web site to retrieve or store information.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows.Web.HTTP when your game needs to access a web site to retrieve or store information.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See [Work with networking in your game](work-with-networking-in-your-directx-game.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Work with networking in your game](work-with-networking-in-your-directx-game.md).

trans-unit.source: Support Utilities - Libraries that build on the Windows 10 APIs.
trans-unit.target: Support Utilities - Libraries that build on the Windows 10 APIs.

trans-unit.source: Library
trans-unit.target: Library

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: DirectX Tool Kit
trans-unit.target: DirectX Tool Kit

trans-unit.source: The DirectX Tool Kit (DirectXTK) is a collection of helper classes for writing DirectX 11.x code in C++.
trans-unit.target: The DirectX Tool Kit (DirectXTK) is a collection of helper classes for writing DirectX 11.x code in C++.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use the DirectX Tool Kit if you're a C++ developer looking for a modern replacement to the legacy D3DX utility code or you're an XNA Game Studio developer transitioning to native C++.
trans-unit.target: Use the DirectX Tool Kit if you're a C++ developer looking for a modern replacement to the legacy D3DX utility code or you're an XNA Game Studio developer transitioning to native C++.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the DirectX Tool Kit project page, [https://github.com/Microsoft/DirectXTK](https://github.com/Microsoft/DirectXTK).
trans-unit.target: See the DirectX Tool Kit project page, [https://github.com/Microsoft/DirectXTK](https://github.com/Microsoft/DirectXTK).

trans-unit.source: Win2D
trans-unit.target: Win2D

trans-unit.source: Win2D is an easy-to-use Windows Runtime API for immediate mode 2D graphics rendering.
trans-unit.target: Win2D is an easy-to-use Windows Runtime API for immediate mode 2D graphics rendering.

trans-unit.source: When to use
trans-unit.target: When to use

trans-unit.source: Use Win2D if you're a C++ developer and want an easier to use WinRT wrapper for Direct2D and DirectWrite, or you're a C# developer wanting to use Direct2D and DirectWrite.
trans-unit.target: Use Win2D if you're a C++ developer and want an easier to use WinRT wrapper for Direct2D and DirectWrite, or you're a C# developer wanting to use Direct2D and DirectWrite.

trans-unit.source: For more information
trans-unit.target: For more information

trans-unit.source: See the Win2D project page, [https://github.com/Microsoft/Win2D](https://github.com/Microsoft/Win2D).
trans-unit.target: See the Win2D project page, [https://github.com/Microsoft/Win2D](https://github.com/Microsoft/Win2D).

trans-unit.source: Xbox Live Services
trans-unit.target: Xbox Live Services

trans-unit.source: The Xbox Live feature set cross play with Xbox, Achievements, Gamerscore, and more is coming to Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: The Xbox Live feature set cross play with Xbox, Achievements, Gamerscore, and more is coming to Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Soon, you'll be able to work with ID@Xbox to include Live in your UWP games!
trans-unit.target: Soon, you'll be able to work with ID@Xbox to include Live in your UWP games!

trans-unit.source: In the future, well also help you ship your universal app platform games on Xbox One.
trans-unit.target: In the future, well also help you ship your universal app platform games on Xbox One.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [ID@Xbox](http://www.xbox.com/developers/id) page.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [ID@Xbox](http://www.xbox.com/developers/id) page.

trans-unit.source: Alternatives to writing games with DirectX and UWP
trans-unit.target: Alternatives to writing games with DirectX and UWP

trans-unit.source: UWP Games without DirectX
trans-unit.target: UWP Games without DirectX

trans-unit.source: Simpler games with minimal performance requirements, such as card games or board games, can be written without DirectX and don't necessarily need to be written in C++.
trans-unit.target: Simpler games with minimal performance requirements, such as card games or board games, can be written without DirectX and don't necessarily need to be written in C++.

trans-unit.source: These sort of games can make use of any of the languages supported by UWP such as C#, Visual Basic, C++, and HTML/JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: These sort of games can make use of any of the languages supported by UWP such as C#, Visual Basic, C++, and HTML/JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: If performance and intensive graphics are not a requirement for your game, checkout [JavaScript and HTML5 touch game sample](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsapps/JavaScript-and-HTML5-touch-d96f6031) as an example.
trans-unit.target: If performance and intensive graphics are not a requirement for your game, checkout [JavaScript and HTML5 touch game sample](http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsapps/JavaScript-and-HTML5-touch-d96f6031) as an example.

trans-unit.source: Game Engines
trans-unit.target: Game Engines

trans-unit.source: As an alternative to writing your own game engine using the Windows game development APIs, many high quality game engines that build on the Windows game development APIs are available for developing games on Windows platforms.
trans-unit.target: As an alternative to writing your own game engine using the Windows game development APIs, many high quality game engines that build on the Windows game development APIs are available for developing games on Windows platforms.

trans-unit.source: When considering a game engine or library, you have multiple options:
trans-unit.target: When considering a game engine or library, you have multiple options:

trans-unit.source: Full game engine - A full game engine encapsulates most or all of the Windows 10 APIs you would use when writing a game engine from scratch, such as graphics, audio, input, and networking.
trans-unit.target: Full game engine - A full game engine encapsulates most or all of the Windows 10 APIs you would use when writing a game engine from scratch, such as graphics, audio, input, and networking.

trans-unit.source: Full game engines may also provide game logic functionality such as artificial intelligence and pathfinding.
trans-unit.target: Full game engines may also provide game logic functionality such as artificial intelligence and pathfinding.

trans-unit.source: Graphics engine - Graphics engines encapsulate the Windows 10 graphics APIs, manage graphics resources, and support a variety of model and world formats.
trans-unit.target: Graphics engine - Graphics engines encapsulate the Windows 10 graphics APIs, manage graphics resources, and support a variety of model and world formats.

trans-unit.source: Audio engine - Audio engines encapsulate the Windows 10 audio APIs, manage audio resources, and provide advanced audio processing and effects.
trans-unit.target: Audio engine - Audio engines encapsulate the Windows 10 audio APIs, manage audio resources, and provide advanced audio processing and effects.

trans-unit.source: Network engine - Network engines encapsulate Windows 10 networking APIs for adding peer-to-peer or server-based multiplayer support to your game, and may include advanced networking functionality to support large numbers of players.
trans-unit.target: Network engine - Network engines encapsulate Windows 10 networking APIs for adding peer-to-peer or server-based multiplayer support to your game, and may include advanced networking functionality to support large numbers of players.

trans-unit.source: Artificial intelligence and pathfinding engine - AI and pathfinding engines provide a framework for controlling the behavior of agents in your game.
trans-unit.target: Artificial intelligence and pathfinding engine - AI and pathfinding engines provide a framework for controlling the behavior of agents in your game.

trans-unit.source: Special purpose engines - A variety of additional engines exist for handling almost any game development related task you might run into, such as creating inventory systems and dialog trees.
trans-unit.target: Special purpose engines - A variety of additional engines exist for handling almost any game development related task you might run into, such as creating inventory systems and dialog trees.

trans-unit.source: Submitting a game to the Store
trans-unit.target: Submitting a game to the Store

trans-unit.source: Once youre ready to publish your game, youll need to create a developer account and submit your game to the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Once youre ready to publish your game, youll need to create a developer account and submit your game to the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: For information about submitting your game to the Windows Store, see <https://dev.windows.com/publish>.
trans-unit.target: For information about submitting your game to the Windows Store, see <https://dev.windows.com/publish>.
